title: Support isn't a desirable enough position right now
body:
Right now I don't think support is very desirable as a role at the moment. Just look at the new champ select, if you queue up as "support" or "fill" as your secondary there is a 60% chance you're going to get support. People are "fine with playing it" but nobody REALLY wants it. Before you just write me off with "hey support's fine go away" or "its just a playstyle choice", I am a (last season) D4 Support Main. I as a support main KNOW that it has power as a role at the moment, is capable of making really big plays and is a viable carry position. But that doesn't actually make it a desirable role. More often than not, instead of feeling like a powerhouse savior of the people, you feel like the b**ch having to get vision by your self, being underfed and underleveled virtually every game. Notice in proplay right now supports aren't even getting level 18 in some of the 40-60 minute games that are happening. I feel like support as a role could really use some love :(

Edit- Hey the **support **(get it? :P) here is great and the feedback for both arguments is really good! I've seen a lot of great ideas on here! One was giving the support items/sightstone XP bonuses. What would you guys think of making support items give bonus xp for every minion you DIDN'T last hit? It would allow supports to be more meaningful early game as they could get overleveled/stay even in levels without them getting to strong. And it wouldn't be abusable by solo laners.

 Edit 2- 
> The single most important thing supports could bring to the team was vision. And now with the current changes those 3 wards you drop do not feel as impact-full.

Do people agree with this? Should supports get more chances to ward in order to carry games or other areas need more work?  
 
I will continue to post good ideas with my thoughts to address current issues up here for discussion.

unfortunatly the problems lie within the underlying gamesystems, not with supports being unfun to play...games get deceided way too early for a support to start having an impact on the map, as in SoloQ he has to stick to his carry during laning most of the time (in proplay it´s less problematic as they just laneswap and carries can farm sidelanes on their own relativly save early on).
Also, vision had been the primary reason to play support up until now - but with the changes you can´t roam around enough to make it stick, so junglers are now the primary agents for setting up vision, leaving support as a hollow being that just walks around with their carry to protect him from hurting himself. Not to mention that vision snowballs way too much still with pinks/blues getting cleared easily by the winning team, so you can´t even stall out games with good vision anymore.

all in all the game lost a lot of strategic depth this preseason and it´s mostly hurting supports, as they were the most strategic role.

> all in all the game lost a lot of strategic depth this preseason and it´s mostly hurting supports, as they were the most strategic role.

Not sure I agree with that statement entirely, but as it pertains to supports and their role in the vision game, that may certainly be true.

well to maybe illuminate that a bit more:

LoL has always had two rather different SRs: 

- 5v5/professional LoL:
here the games are still pretty strategic, though right now you also see that games turn into "lategame" at min 20already if teams make a single wrong step along the way - it´s just so much more punishing than last seasons, and therefor shotcalling from behind (which always has been hard) gets almost impossible...leaving only the winning team with strategic options for the most part.

- SoloQ:
games here are mostly won in Champselect atm, and they snowball out of control insanly fast as you donßt have the coordination to shut down hypermobile threats at any point. Also - many times the jungler will refuse to go wardstone/trinket and sometimes even the support will do so, leaving you absolutly blind and robbing the game of all strategy except outguessing your opponents. EDIT: to elaborate it a tad more - the prvious seasons support had been my go-to if i really wanted to win, as usually it´s farily easy to carry the laning-phase and then setting up vison to control the rest of the map and make sure your team can savly close out the game. Now even if i win the lane rather hard i struggle controlling even just vison around the bottom of the map - compared to playing jungle, were i just have a lot more options to set deepwards early on and move the wards around the map as the pressure shifts.. though if you ever fall behind none of the roles will provide nearly enough vision to make the game feel even remotly under control anymore.


main Reasons for this development from my PoV:

- items are too expensive/to reliant on scaling, so if you fall behind you will take longer to reach your core-gear to at least have a decent chance of making a play of your opponents mistakes. 
- vision just snowballs more as there are less greenwards and pinks/blues can be cleared out with ease by the team in control, sort of as with S2 oracles - winning teams have it easier to defend their oracles and to kill the oracles of their opponents (a good sign of how broken vision is atm is that about any midlaner in proplay will still go spooky-ghosts to make sure the team has an option to avoid facechecking later on)
- some champdesign is still really far off regarding to offering any counterplay (e.g. fiora 1v1) or regarding to risk/reward (e.g. ecco with a very feast or famine pattern depending on how good he is landing his sorta broken AoE-stun or not).

When games end in 20 mins, how is that not losing strategic depth? You no longer have an objective thats worth dying for, and before you think Im attacking League, Im not. I still love this game, but it doesnt feel nearly as close to the chess match it used to be. I feel like Riot gives us "new and cool" strategic options all the time, through items and other means, but It also feels that every time a new option comes 2 were taken in its spot. In season 1 you were called a troll if you tried to support without CV as your summoner spell. THe new blue trinket is cool because it gives a cv that doesnt go away until its cleared, but in some situations like an attempt on a baron steal, that blue trinket is useless, where at least cv couldnt instantly get cleared. Im not even trying to argue the viability of CV, im just saying if you give us all of the strategic peices at the same time, maybe their wouldnt always feel like there was a lack of strategic diversity.

Question: do reworks count as a release for a class?

What I mean is, typically you guys don't release two of the same class right in a row (with some exceptions obviously) so poppy was released as a tank/fighter. Taric is a support, so do you guys try to not release another support around the same time or do champUP and champion not communicate like that?

I think generally we try not to release champions or champion updates of the same class repeatedly, but there's no real rule against it. There's more just a general understanding that it sucks for some groups of players if all we do is release the same type of champion over and over again.

Supports really just need a way to earn XP without leeching off other lanes.
This. Supports need a way to get fed so to speak. They need a way to "snowball" and become scarier. Not just snowballing they're adc.
XP from roaming would be perfect, in my opinion, but I don't know how it could be actually implemented without abuse.

You don't need to pidgeonhole that.  Just give supports XP for doing what they do.  Warding could grant XP.  Healing an ally could grant XP.  Spelltheif's changes could grant XP.  Relic Sheild could give the support the full XP like Morde's passive used to do when a charge is used.

It doesn't have to be just XP for roaming.  Bard doesn't have XP problems because of his passive.  Just give supports XP for doing their job properly, and you'll notice people playing the role more.

Support will never be desirable by the mere design of the role.

1.  In laning you are entirely reliant on your ADC not being a potato. If you're ADC is a potato you're fighting a 1v2 lane where the enemy is getting fed (probably resulting in you feeding). As a result of this you will fall even further behind.

2.  An assassin will pretty much always be able to burst you down. Go to ward the wrong bush and you can say good bye to your health bar. This problem is more noticeable with mage supports but a behind tank support can suffer from the same issue.

3. Most ADC mains are toxic and you tend to take the blunt of the blame, deserved or not. (Shout out to junglers)

4. Support doesn't get to hard carry by being an unkillable tank, a flashy assassin or the hyper carry (Unless you're a very fed support). As a result the position is undesirable. Nobody wants to be the second fiddle, most would rather be the main character.

5. Off meta supports are not well liked. Although this applies to a lot of roles support players get to choose between 26 champions (http://champion.gg/statistics/#?sortBy=general.experience&order=descend&roleSort=Support) while most of the other roles get approximately 50. The notable exception being ADC.

6. You have no 1v1 potential (Outside of being very fed) because of gold and experience disadvantage.

7. People want to want ranked games and a lot of people consider support to be a role which you cannot carry from and this is true (TO SOME EXTENT) as you far more reliant on your team and hoping they make the right decisions. After all you only have so much CC and peel.

8. You are obligated to be a ward *****. This is truer at lower elo but the preseason changes didn't help this (Seeing as now laners can only buy pink wards and the blue trinket keeps getting nerfed).

Support is just a role where you feel like someone else's *****. You cannot make plays on your own (Unless you are really fed). Land a Blitz hook, great if other people are there to kill them.

Also {{champion:1}} is not a support, she is a mage sent bot (http://champion.gg/champion/Annie/Support).

I don't understand the point of this post.

Support is and always has been and always will be a niche role that only a few of us like to take on. You can make characters like {{champion:432}} or {{champion:223}} that help bring in some of the anti-Supporters, but ultimately the core gameplay behind support is what's not appealing and no unique champion design can fix that.

I also don't think there needs to be a macro update to the game dynamics just to bring in a few people who want to support. It's something everyone should accept. It's just like on MMOs where healers are arguably the least played role. Folks like to damage more than they do help.

The entire point is that it is considered a "niche role". Seriously its one of the 5 main roles in the game how can it just be written off as a niche role? My issue is that the core gameplay behind support (as a support main) simply isn't meaningful enough without enormous knowledge and skill. Support is fine right now but as a support you rarely actually feel like a powerful member of the team. You mostly are a cc/vision bot. Supports fantasy of being a powerful savior of the team that makes allies meaningfully more useful isn't as good as it could be. I have level 5 mastery on both bard and kench and experience on pretty much every popular support. I know how strong support can be. I know how it can carry. But I think support needs to FEEL more important and meaningful to play. Not just the "niche role" where you carry from the shadows. I'm not saying it needs to be glamorous but you should feel important as a member of the team.

Because other lanes will abuse the items. And Riot isn't creative enough to figure out how to fix the problem without gutting the item. Like they are actively doing with the frost queen.
You know i kinda feel like they wont ever be able to fix supports unless they specifically make support items only work with support champions.
That still means these guys are spending 800+ gold on a +hp item in a solo lane.

Yeah, Supports are power houses, but they don't feel like them. They can make plays they can win games, but they don't have any flashy numbers to go with them. Not only that, but supports cannot carry, you can set your team up for success all day long but if your team falls flat on their face, all your efforts just go right out the window. 

Also I mentioned numbers, and just going by  numbers, they don't really shine at all. I play a lot of Leona support, and there were many times I'd look at my stats after the match, and unless I simply crushed my lane, I'd have the lowest damage dealt, and even the lowest damage tanked (compared to Top and Jungle), despite being in the middle of every team fight.

Not only that, but assists just aren't praised that much by the game. When someone gets a kill, they see a big box with their picture and sword smacking the other guy, and the assist just gets this tiny little box next to it. All in all, support can feel very unrewarding to play at times, and I think there can be something  done to help with that
To help wih numbers, Riot should implement _Damage shielded_. Unfortunately that wouldn't help Leona, though.

The single most important thing supports could bring to the team was vision. And now with the current changes those 3 wards you drop do not feel as impact-full. This mean Riot needed something else to make players feel they could really contribute to the game. But for whatever reason support, as a role, has been over looked in the past year/two years.

I think it's because there's nothing flashy about getting assists. There's no recognition by the game when you make an amazing support play. You know, and your teammates might know, but when you save everyone's life and set up the kill on the enemy's carry in a teamfight there's no "pentassist". I'm not sure how it would be implemented well but if people got some positive feedback when they play well as a support I think that'd go a long way to making it desirable.

IMO it's because riot's afraid to let support's power curve ever be strong.  Sure, it probably shouldn't be strong late - that's when carries should shine, but when Riot also makes carries' laning relatively strong, it really shuts things like supports out from having meaningful fantasies.  ADC should be weak in lane, not gifted easy sustain and strong skills.  Lane bully tops and mids should pay for that strength lategame (and lategame should actually happen once in a blue moon).  Supports should be the opposite, in both cases, while obviously not being as strong as either in their strongest phases.

Also, more interesting itemization would go a long way.  Just look at the utility active items available in Dota.  Those exact items would be broken in LOL, but should serve as a guide for itemization that's more interesting than gp10...sightstone...boots...yaaaaawn.
